description:
Stay cozy this winter, all while doing your part to reduce ocean plastics. The Downdrift Parka has been designed from the ground up with sustainability in mind. This insulated, waterproof breathable parka uses shell material made from 100% recycled fishing nets. The cloud-like down clusters are recycled, so’s the lining material, and the plush fleece strategically placed throughout the garment. Patagonia has created a parka that can warm your heart and your body.

  • Waterproof breathable 2-layer NetPlus® recycled nylon shell is made from recycled fishing nets and has a PFC-free DWR finish
  • Recycled 600 fill-power duck and goose down insulation is warm, light and easy to compress
  • Smooth recycled taffeta lining layers easily
  • High pile sherpa fleece lining in the hand pockets, hood, and across the shoulders
  • Insulated hood for when you forget your toque, or the weather is truly nasty
  • Zippered hand pockets, dual drop-in pockets and an interior zippered pocket
  • 2-way zipper lets you open your coat from the bottom, meaning you only need to open your coat a little when you want to sit down
  • Snap-down storm flap keeps icy winds from creeping in
  • Snap adjustable cuffs help seal out the cold
  • Regular fit wears just like you want it to
name: Patagonia Downdrift Parka - Men's

value: 600 fill-power recycled goose and duck down blend
